meanings.def: a public celebration of a special day or event, usually with bands in the streets and decorated vehicles
examples: the Lord Mayor’s parade
St Patrick’s Day parade in New York
The parade is held every year.
Thousands of people were at the parade.

meanings.def: a formal occasion when soldiers march or stand in lines so that they can be inspected (= looked at and approved) by their officers or other important people
examples: a military parade
They held a parade to mark the soldiers' return.
on parade They stood as straight as soldiers on parade.
(figurative) The latest software will be on parade at the exhibition.

meanings.def: a series of things or people
examples: Each generation passes through a similar parade of events.

meanings.def: a street with a row of small shops
examples: a shopping parade

meanings.def: an obvious display of something, particularly in order to impress other people
examples: Social media is a constant parade of wealth, happiness, success and vanity.

meanings.def: to prevent somebody from enjoying an event; to cause somebody's plans to fail

idioms.def: to prevent somebody from enjoying an event; to cause somebody's plans to fail

meanings.def: to walk somewhere in a formal group of people, in order to celebrate or protest about something
examples: The victorious team will parade through the city tomorrow morning.

meanings.def: to walk around in a way that makes other people notice you
examples: People were parading up and down showing off their finest clothes.

meanings.def: to show somebody/something in public so that people can see them/it
examples: The trophy was paraded around the stadium.
The prisoners were paraded in front of the crowd.
(figurative) He is not one to parade his achievements.

meanings.def: to come together, or to bring soldiers together, in order to march (= walk formally) in front of other people
examples: + adv./prep. The crowds applauded as the guards paraded past.
parade somebody + adv./prep. The colonel paraded his men before the Queen.

meanings.def: to pretend to be, or to make somebody/something seem to be, good or important when they are not
examples: parade as something myth parading as fact
parade somebody/something/yourself as something He paraded himself as a loyal supporter of the party.
